{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3423824,"name":"","username":"Kavin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-15T02:28:29.301Z","cooked":"

Last year, we switched controllers to Xbox 1 controllers and started to use CommandXboxController over what we had previously, Joystick. This meant that we stopped using the Logitech controllers we used previously. Now, we want to use them for some workshops, but we want them used as CommandXboxControllers to match our real code. However, they are not detected as CommandXboxControllers, and I have tried swapping the ports and changing from direct to x input to no avail. I know it is possible to use them as it is said they can be used in the docs. Is there any way to fix this issue and connect them properly as CommandXboxControllers?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-09-15T02:28:29.301Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":986,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":4947.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471254,"topic_slug":"how-to-setup-the-logitech-f310-controller-for-commandxboxcontroller","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63542,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-setup-the-logitech-f310-controller-for-commandxboxcontroller/471254/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3423825,"name":"Jared Van Horn","username":"CuteRedpandas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-15T02:36:24.732Z","cooked":"

Even if the driver station detects the controller as a non xbox controller it should still work as long as the controller is set to the correct port.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-09-15T02:36:24.732Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":80.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471254,"topic_slug":"how-to-setup-the-logitech-f310-controller-for-commandxboxcontroller","display_username":"Jared Van Horn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum/NJIT Student"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-setup-the-logitech-f310-controller-for-commandxboxcontroller/471254/2","custom_user_title":"Alum/NJIT Student","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3423830,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-15T03:31:06.179Z","cooked":"

However, they are not detected as CommandXboxControllers

If you’re expecting the DriverStation to show CommandXboxController, it won’t. CommandXboxController is a WPILib-specific wrapper around the GenericHID class, which treats all of those gamepads the same

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-09-15T03:31:06.179Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":93,"readers_count":92,"score":58.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471254,"topic_slug":"how-to-setup-the-logitech-f310-controller-for-commandxboxcontroller","display_username":"Tim Winters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"78 AIR Strike Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-setup-the-logitech-f310-controller-for-commandxboxcontroller/471254/3","custom_user_title":"78 AIR Strike Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3423839,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-15T04:30:03.570Z","cooked":"

The logitech F310s should work with XboxController/CommandXboxController if they are set to XInput mode (the switch on the back set to “X”). Make sure you unplug and plug it back in after switching. One way to tell if the switch is working is that in XInput mode the DS should show the triggers as axes, not buttons.

Sorry for the delay in replying.

So, for some reason, the controller input just started working the next day for some reason without me changing anything? I’m not sure why, but it did. I did have to use X-input mode, and in another place in the code, I had to swap to using a supplier, because I wasn’t previously(a silly mistake by me).

Thanks for the help!
